links.quantification: ESZ enforcement → 67,000 km² development-free → habitat connectivity preserved → tiger populations stable 3000→3500 (reinforcing)
Watershed protection → 40% of India's rivers originate in protected forests → 200 BCM/year flow sustained → ₹20K Cr water security
Forest preservation → 300 MT CO₂/year sequestration + PM2.5 filtration → ₹15K Cr climate/health benefits
Mining opposition: ESZ blocks ₹50K Cr coal/mineral projects → industry lobbying → SC litigation → enforcement dilution pressure
City expansion limits: ESZ restricts 500 cities → ₹30K Cr real estate value affected → political resistance to compliance
Ecotourism → 5M visitors/year → ₹8K Cr rural incomes → community conservation incentives grow (reinforcing)
Requires wildlife corridors: ESZ only effective with overpasses/underpasses for highways → ₹5K Cr infrastructure prerequisite
Via watershed protection: Forest conservation → city water supply reliability +30% → ₹10K Cr infrastructure savings
Via carbon sequestration: Forest preservation → climate regulation → heat stress reduction → ₹3K Cr health benefits
Via livelihoods: Ecotourism income → poaching declines → wildlife populations recover → habitat value increases
Via development pressure: Mining blocked → industrial relocation to non-ESZ areas → urban sprawl concentration increases
